meanings.definition: A person or thing that sticks.
meanings.sent1: The sticky sticker held the paper together.
meanings.sent2: The frog's long tongue acted like a sticker catching flies.
meanings.sent3: The sticker on the team was the player who never gave up.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a sticker, sticking in my mind long after she had left.
meanings.sent5: The sticker on the tree trunk showed the way to the hidden treasure.

meanings.definition: A small piece of paper, fabric, plastic, or similar material with an adhesive backing that can be attached to a surface.
meanings.sent1: She put a sticker on her notebook to personalize it.
meanings.sent2: The teacher gave out stickers to the students for their good work.
meanings.sent3: The sticker on the wall added a pop of color to the room.
meanings.sent4: The sticker on the laptop represented her favorite band.
meanings.sent5: He collected stickers from different countries to decorate his suitcase.

meanings.definition: A label or decal that can be affixed to an object.
meanings.sent1: The sticker on the jar showed the ingredients of the jam.
meanings.sent2: She carefully peeled off the sticker from the new book.
meanings.sent3: The sticker on the toy car made it look more realistic.
meanings.sent4: The sticker on the gift box added a festive touch.
meanings.sent5: He placed a sticker on his luggage to easily identify it at the airport.
